In your project you are encouraging individuals for individual braining storming for idea generation and output of this you will consolidate into a single map to reflect commonality and difference. Which technique are you using?
During requirements collection you decide that everyone agrees on a single course of action for certain kind of decisions. Which method are you using to make those decisions?

In a meeting with stakeholders you are verifying that all items currently in the scope are really necessary or if functions could be provided at a lower cost without degrading performance or quality of the deliverables. Which product analysis are you using?
Which of the following best describes the difference between project deliverables and project requirements?

Answers: Deliverables are specific items that must be produced to consider the project or project phase complete. A phase can have one deliverable and many requirements.
Requirements are measurable items that must be produced to consider the project or project phase complete. A phase can have multiple deliverable and many requirements.
Requirements are measurable items that must be produced to consider the project or project phase complete. Deliverables are the specifications of the product, services or result need to be delivered.

Deliverables are specific items that must be produced to consider the project or project phase complete. Requirements are the specifications of the deliverables used to tell you if the deliverables were produced successfully.

Question: Within one week of project scope statement baseline customer comes to and mentions that frozen requirements does not support our newly changed marketing strategy therefore contract need to be amended. After this change is evaluated and you found substantial change in cost and schedule which has been approved by customer. What is your next step?

Answers: Cost and Schedule has been approved by the customer therefore do nothing
Adjust your baselines as per newly approved cost and schedule.

Question: Sponsor decided that although all will participate to give input but only Jim will make the decision. Which decision making technique is this?
A discipline deals with interdisciplinary field of engineering that focuses on how complex engineering projects should be designed and managed over the life cycle of the project.
Prototypes as tool & technique used in which process

How requirements activities will be planned, tracked, reported. The method of initiating changes to the product, method of analyzing changes requests and defining authorization levels requires to approve any change. All this is part of
Scope creep is

Answers: Changes must for the project’s success

Question: Organization process assets are utilized when you are performing ----- Process

On your project one of your team member presented a solution to you. It was not impressive and you were not convinced, but after lots of discussion and questions and answers you approved the proposal and the undertaking was launched. It was too late when you discovered that it was a mistake and will result in substantial losses to your company. What do you do next?

Answers: Step forward and announce to your management that you made a wrong decision.
Fire the team member and clean the house, after all it was his idea.
You and your team member both should take responsibility and resign from the job.
Submit your resignation, confident that your management will not accept it; after all you did not do it your personal gain.

Question: In your project meeting you discovered that the one stakeholder will have a problem with the system if you do not implement a change to the software. The estimate for the implementation of the change is one weeks. What do you do next?

Answers: Implementing change will delay the project and it will cause problem to other stakeholders so do not allow any change.
Instruct your team to implement the change. As a project manager it is your responsibility to meet the requirements of the stakeholders.
Discuss the change with the stakeholder to figure out if they really need the change.
Document the change and its impact and process the change request through CCB.

Question: You are the project manager for complex data analysis tool. As a project manager you are working on this tool since last 10 months  . A newly hired R&D head is one of the stakeholder of this project. What will you do now?

Answers: Add newly hired R&D head into your stakeholder register.
Schedule a meeting with new R&D head to ensure that he knows the current requirements and determine if he might have new requirements to add to the project.
Mail a copy of the project charter & project management plan to him so that he know that you are project manager of this project and what you are trying to achieve.
Keep working on the project. At the time of system implementation CEO will introduce you when needed.

Question: You are managing a construction of a huge residential project. You are planning to invite contractors for plumbing work. You know that your cousin owns a reputed plumbing company and he can provide quality services on this project. He meets you over dinner and proposes to submit the quotation. How would you manage this situation?

Answers: You inform your company about the conflict of interests and select the contractor based on objective criteria.
You outsource the work to your cousin and inform your company, after all he is giving high quality services.
You inform your company about the conflict and exclude your cousin from the bid.

You inform your company about the conflict and keep yourself out from this process. However to ensure quality services to your company you provide your cousin additional information that other bidder do not have.

Question: "PMP Code of Professional Conduct" does not apply in which situation?

Answers: Reporting experience and PMP status truthfully.
Complying with the rules and standards of foreign countries.
